record.description: Count Shigenobu Ōkuma, [statesman and Waseda University president], entertains University of Chicago, Keio, and Waseda Universities' Baseball Team players and the United States Ambassador at his home. The University of Chicago team won 17 games while in Japan. H. J. Ehrhorn, a team member, presented the picture postcard to the library.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
record.noteGeneral: U.S. ambassador is probably Thomas O'Brian who was in Japan from 1907 to 1911, not Charles B. Warren who served from 1921 to 1922.
